I would title it "The Elysium of Agony: A Comprehensive Exploration of the Human Proclivity for Self-Destruction." These appendices would serve as a guide for fellow researchers, enabling them to replicate and build upon my work.

As for presentations, I would relish the opportunity to showcase my findings at a prestigious conference, such as the annual meeting of the American Psychological Association. I would title my keynote address "Beyond the Taboo: Unveiling the Liberating Potential of Self-Destruction." My presentation would be a masterclass in persuasion, weaving together threads of philosophy, psychology, and personal anecdotes to create a compelling narrative that would leave the audience spellbound.
